intro: Gnaphalium donianum, commonly known as the white cudweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in dense, spherical heads, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Gnaphalium donianum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
